author: Philipp Breuss-Schneeweis
comment: I have many watchfaces, but honestly, I think this is the most useful one, because it shows an up to date, unique, and always new picture of my favorite places. The Golden Gate bridge, the skiing slope close to my place, or the view from my local yacht club, I always carry these views with me!

author: Caleb Peters
comment: Screen captures don't show it, but you are able to remove all text on the watch face in the paid version. Looks good!

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: Screen shots usually take a few seconds to be done (See the menu option in the Android Wear App on your phone). I also noticed, the sometimes these are black. Just try again. If the screenshot is black, this is a general issue, unrelated to this watch face.

title: Does what it promises

author: Sarah Bullock
comment: I need help with this app.cannot download my local webcam

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content:
Hello Sarah, the webcam you've sent us per email can not be accessed via a static image url. Best would be if you contact the webcam provider directly and ask for a "static image url" - most likely they have one.
All the best,
Your Wear.Webcam team

author: Clarence Moore
comment: Love the face, especially the cloud one. I have a camera at home though that is a dlink 5222l I connect to through ddns. I would like to use it but I can't get it to show up, the url pasted in from opening the image never refreshes and I don't know if it's because the camera is password protected or what. Any ideas?

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: Hello Clarence, please make sure that you supply user name and password in the correct way. However, according to this, http://www.ispyconnect.com/man.aspx?n=dlink they don't use it with username and password. Perhaps you remove username and password and try it then. If it works, you'll know the reason. Not: only jpeg and mjpeg works now.

title: Need a little help

author: dawn berry
comment: I cant see how to get into it.  The face when i down loaded it looks lovely.  I Cant slate it as i cant  find it.   Now found it and love it

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: Hi Dawn, great that you love it! Still it looks like you had some problems getting there. Perhaps you can give me more details, such that we can improve the overall experience. All the best, Phil

title: Me

author: Ramon Cofi
comment: Very bad  pésimo no lo recomiendo lo siento

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: Hello Ramon, please specify what exactly did not work when you tried wear.webcam. Please note that 'very bad' discourages other people from using wear.webcam (even though we have very good ratings in general), and you also don't give the developer a chance to improve what you did not like. If you want a refund, send an email to info@wear.webcam.

author: Scott Getter
comment: Combine this with xeoma and you have a perfect combination!!
title: Awesome!

author: Anders von Reis Crooks
comment: Developer at least responds. To the developer, you wanted examples. Apps are examples not spam. I was trying to give you concrete examples of UI and interfaces that work. The fact is your watchface is missing very basic stuff , weather, battery power for phone and watch, basic stuff. This app is very expensive for what it is and it's competition. almost two dollars for what should have been free or 99 cents at most.

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content:
Hello Anders, 
you can remove all texts already now in the Settings.(please explain more in detail). Battery power is shown on the line between time and date. You can change text color and font in the menu.
24 hour mode and analog watch style is now implemented as of version 2.96. For additional features let us know. Cheers, your Wear.Webcam Team

title: Rerated. basic issues for now. save your money

author: Robb McMahan
comment: I'll update my review score if these are addressed but for now there are not enough features. Wear.webcam watermark should be removed since I paid. There should be an option to not show seconds. There should be an option for watch and phone battery level. There was only one can by default, there should be more. Good idea but not ready for prime time in my opinion because its too limited.

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: Hi Robb, with version 2.7+, on the Settings screen, at the bottom, you can select to hide wear.webcam and you can hide the time, when the cam has been updated. As of version 2.96 you can choose analoge watch mode and 24 or 12 hour mode. Battery level is also implemented. Cheers, Your Wear.Webcam Team

title: Lacking features

author: Andrew Fisher
comment: Love this app although I would give it 5* if I had the option to remove the "wear.webcam" and the "moments ago" text! Just so it had the time and the date at the top. Can you make this happen, keep it on the trial but for us that have paid can you add this feature please!

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: Hi Andrew, with version 2.7+ both of your requested features have been implemented: on the Settings screen, at the bottom, you can select to hide wear.webcam and you can hide the time, when the cam has been updated. If you want the last update time as part of the title, just add "last_updated" (without quotes) somewhere in the field webcam info).

title: Great idea!

author: Allan Hagan
comment: Great idea, paid my money. Bug fixes are regular.

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content:
Hello Allan,
This bug has been fixed (Version 1.2).

Paris:
http://images.webcams.travel/original/1222262383-Weather-Paris-panorama-Paris-02-Bourse.jpg
Nice:
http://images.webcams.travel/original/1391471255-Weather-Nizza-Office-du-Tourisme-Nice.jpg

There is a support page:
Support page: https://plus.google.com/communities/105805748857237012543

title: Try to find a webcam that works with this not easy

author: Martinez Family
comment: I love the idea of this, just wish there was a way to put the time at the top so the notifications don't cover it it.  -Thanks for the super fast update, works great

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content:
Hello Martinez Family, 
Thank you for your feedback. Version 1.1 with this feature implemented is now live!
Please check out the Wear.Webcam Settings on your mobile, it has now "Position of the Time" added. 
Best regards,
Philipp

title: Awesome idea

author: Andrew Jones-McGuire
comment: Brilliant app - does exactly what I want - but have sent a request by email to help out those of us who have OLED displays.

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: In version 1.5, showing the background image or black in Ambient mode is an option within the Wear.Webcam Settings on your phone (customer requested both options for Ambient Mode - black and background image shown).

title: Fantastic - just what I was looking for

reply.author: Schneeweis.Technology
reply.content: Hi Find, how do you like the new animationed webcams as of version 2.1? Cheers, Philipp
